For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Genetics and Human Genetics</title>   <subtitle>Recognised internationally for our world-class research portfolio and excellence in teaching, Nottingham's School of Life Sciences contains one of the leading genetics and human genetics divisions in the UK. We provide excellent teaching informed by cutting-edge research and our modular system allows a choice of subject areas and themes within a genetics and human genetics degree.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/geneticsandhumangenetics/geneticsandhumangenetics.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/geneticsandhumangenetics/geneticsandhumangenetics.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-06T08:41:00Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/geneticsandhumangenetics/geneticsandhumangenetics.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Genetics BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/geneticsandhumangenetics/bsc-genetics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>Over the last decade, genetics and genetic technologies have had a major impact on the understanding of human biology and disease. This degree enables you to gain an understanding of major advances across virtually the whole field of genetics, including microbial and evolutionary genetics.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:02:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-03T09:31:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/geneticsandhumangenetics/bsc-genetics.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Genetics MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/geneticsandhumangenetics/msci-genetics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Jayne Holgate</name>     </author>     <summary>Over the last decade, genetics and genetic technologies have had a major impact on the understanding of human biology and disease. This degree enables you to gain an understanding of major advances across virtually the whole field of genetics, including microbial and evolutionary genetics.</summary>
